definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: The sweater is ornamented with jeweled embroideries.
sentences.chinese: 这件毛衣用镶宝石的刺绣作装饰。

sentences.english: The Company is a professional manufacturer of all types of high-tech computer embroidering machines.
sentences.chinese: 是一家专业生产各类高科技电脑刺绣机的生产厂家。

sentences.english: Chinese stitchery, you know, is beautifully patterned and exquisitely embroidered.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，中国刺绣品图案精美，绣工精巧。

sentences.english: Among ethnic groups, Bai , Bouyei and Miao people are also adept at embroidery.
sentences.chinese: 在民族，白族，布依族和苗族人还善于刺绣。

sentences.english: Zhao Junxin learned the craft of embroidering from his grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 赵俊信从奶奶那里学到了刺绣的手艺。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a fur paste-up reel which belongs to the field of brede craftwork products.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型涉及刺绣工艺制品领域的毛皮拼贴卷轴。

sentences.english: Beading and embroidery products first computer automatically, high efficiency at reasonable prices.
sentences.chinese: 首创电脑自动钉珠刺绣产品，效率高价格平。

sentences.english: Heavy embroidery was used, and robes often including brocade and elaborate stoles.
sentences.chinese: 刺绣是重使用，披肩长袍往往包括博科和阐述。

sentences.english: Each embroidery is designed step by step.
sentences.chinese: 将描图纸打洞是刺绣设计的前置步骤。

sentences.english: Please quote us your lowest price for the embroideries.
sentences.chinese: 请告知我们你方对刺绣品给出的最低报价。
运动帽，服装，刺绣工艺品制造。

sentences.english: Especially important for new mouldable embroidery placements.
sentences.chinese: 特别是可模的定位刺绣。

sentences.english: Try realistic crocheting with tips from a needlework specialist in this free video on crochet pieces.
sentences.chinese: 尝试在此免费视频钩针作品从现实钩编刺绣专家提示。

sentences.english: The artist is exploring the probability of "paint" on the canvas with cotton thread.
sentences.chinese: 在油画布上以刺绣棉线作画，并把数学曲线作为形象。

sentences.english: I'd like to see how well Han Jia has learned her embroidery.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想看看韩佳学刺绣学得怎么样。
她给她的床单刺绣上了花边。

definition: Jacquard weave (machine weaving leaving protruding pattern)
batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
